# Plot Review of RF Test Set Confusion Matrix:

## Bad Plot(s)

## Revised Plot(s)
![alt text](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/159090915/513635798-5677c110-6caa-4f16-9641-a24bd0a821fa.png?jwt=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJnaXRodWIuY29tIiwiYXVkIjoicmF3LmdpdGh1YnVzZXJjb250ZW50LmNvbSIsImtleSI6ImtleTUiLCJleHAiOjE3NjUxNDQwOTYsIm5iZiI6MTc2NTE0Mzc5NiwicGF0aCI6Ii8xNTkwOTA5MTUvNTEzNjM1Nzk4LTU2NzdjMTEwLTZjYWEtNGYxNi05NjQxLWEyNGJkMGE4MjFmYS5wbmc_.Xeq2xgi6CSAemYBARFvdpoYjw7xczMnaJIAsCagjKJ0 "Revised Plot 1")

![alt text](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/159090915/513635878-c7ae8cbe-8eee-41a7-a3c5-9978643894a2.png?jwt=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJpc3MiOiJnaXRodWIuY29tIiwiYXVkIjoicmF3LmdpdGh1YnVzZXJjb250ZW50LmNvbSIsImtleSI6ImtleTUiLCJleHAiOjE3NjUxNDQwOTYsIm5iZiI6MTc2NTE0Mzc5NiwicGF0aCI6Ii8xNTkwOTA5MTUvNTEzNjM1ODc4LWM3YWU4Y2JlLThlZWUtNDFhNy1hM2M1LTk5Nzg2NDM4OTRhMi5wbmc_.yNpW5f5bKBh93jclTwNhj4h9xCae6TCalhuyoSxRZ1A "Revised Plot 2")

These plots both portray the data from Alex Bruce's HW8, the Higgs Boson Search assignment. Both plots portray the RF Test Set data portrayed in a confusion matrix, with one plot without and the other with normalization. I believe that both the bad plot and the redone plot are basically the same, except the coloration of each quadrent of the matrix was changed to give greater visual clarity as humans have a difficult time with gradients, and I believe that that the revised blue color spectrum does a better job at this. Some of the actual data values changed as well between plots.

In terms of review consideration, ambiguity between both plots is low, as both are confusion matricies and the overall structure of the plot has not changed. Distortion has been improved, as with the re-coloration of the value scale, values and trends are more distinguishable. As for distraction, both plots do a good job at not having any distracting elements as there are no uncessisary features. In terms of Tufte's rules, I believe effect size is the same between the two as numerical value size is consistant. Data/ink is unchanging between the two graphs. There is no chart junk between the two garphs. Small multiples are not used, and finally there is no redundancy in communication as while both figures do portray the same information, the normalized plot is more easilly interperateable by humans in terms of trends, while the non-normalized figure portrays the scale of the data, with I believe justifies the inclusion of both.
